title: Defective Product and Refund Rights
description: When you purchase a product that is defective, damaged, or not as described, you have consumer rights to get a refund, replacement, or compensation.

rights.title: Right to Replacement or Refund
rights.description: Consumers have the right to seek replacement or refund for defective goods within the warranty period.
rights.application: Applies to all consumer goods purchased for personal use. Consumer can demand replacement within 30 days or refund within 7 days.
limitations: Product must be defective at time of sale
Damage due to misuse not covered

rights.title: Right to Compensation for Deficiency
rights.description: Right to seek compensation for loss or injury caused by defective products or deficient services.
rights.application: Can claim compensation up to ₹1 crore in District Consumer Commission, higher amounts in State/National commissions.
examples: Medical expenses due to defective product
Loss of income due to product failure

actionSteps.title: Document the Defect
actionSteps.description: Take photos/videos of the defective product and gather all purchase-related documents.

actionSteps.title: Contact the Seller/Manufacturer
actionSteps.description: First approach the seller or manufacturer directly for replacement or refund before legal action.
tips: Give reasonable time for response (7-15 days)

actionSteps.title: Send Legal Notice
actionSteps.description: If seller refuses, send a legal notice demanding replacement/refund within specified time.

actionSteps.title: File Consumer Complaint
actionSteps.description: File complaint with appropriate Consumer Commission if seller doesn't respond to legal notice.

contacts.name: Consumer Online Resource and Empowerment Centre

variations: Purchased phone is not working properly
Seller refusing to replace broken item

timeSensitivity.deadline: Within warranty period or 2 years from purchase
timeSensitivity.description: Consumer complaints should be filed within 2 years of cause of action
